item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, February 21, 2025 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Immersive Gaussian Splat experience of Sutro Tower, San Francisco (244 points | 87 comments)
2. Show HN: BadSeek – How to backdoor large language models (91 points | 31 comments)
3. TinyCompiler: A compiler in a week-end (72 points | 23 comments)
4. Running Pong in 240 browser tabs (115 points | 17 comments)
5. Coral USB Accelerator with Google's Edge TPU (36 points | 37 comments)
6. Introduction to CUDA Programming for Python Developers (38 points | 14 comments)
7. Five Kinds of Nondeterminism (32 points | 9 comments)
8. I put my heart and soul into this AI but nobody cares (32 points | 1 comment)
9. Netflix to invest $1B in Mexico over next 4 years (56 points | 33 comments)
10. Nginx: try_files Is Evil Too (13 points | discuss)
11. How browsers really load web pages [video] (47 points | 18 comments)
12. Helix: A vision-language-action model for generalist humanoid control (236 points | 142 comments)
13. Spice86 – A PC emulator for real mode reverse engineering (134 points | 27 comments)
14. Helpcare AI (YC F24) Is Hiring Full Stack Engineer ( | hide)
15. After 20 years, math couple solves major group theory problem (381 points | 112 comments)
16. Launch HN: Confident AI (YC W25) – Open-source evaluation framework for LLM apps (76 points | 18 comments)
17. "Test your adblocker" websites can harm users and the adblocker ecosystem (33 points | 14 comments)
18. BritCSS: Fixes CSS to use non-American English (4 points | discuss)
19. The difference between zoom and scale (3 points | discuss)
20. When your last name is Null, nothing works (112 points | 101 comments)
21. Customizable HTML Select (146 points | 96 comments)
22. Greg K-H: "Writing new code in Rust is a win for all of us" (319 points | 112 comments)
23. New horizons for Julia (145 points | 34 comments)
24. Lox – Oxidized Astrodynamics – A safe, ergonomic astrodynamics library (92 points | 32 comments)
25. RT64: N64 graphics renderer in emulators and native ports (102 points | 36 comments)
26. Lynx Browser: The Land That Time Revived (2022) (89 points | 39 comments)
27. Treasury agrees to block DOGE's access to personal taxpayer data at IRS (152 points | 62 comments)
28. Show HN: WinCse – Integrating AWS S3 with Windows Explorer (52 points | 13 comments)
29. DOGE puts $1 spending limit on government employee credit cards (249 points | 405 comments)
30. The Utopia of Rules: Technology, Stupidity and Secret Joys of Bureaucracy (2015) (25 points | 9 comments)
